verses.text: On the day Moses finished setting up the tabernacle, he anointed and consecrated it, along with all its furnishings, the altar, and all its utensils. He anointed and consecrated them.
verses.comment: This translation retains the original sense of Moses completing and sanctifying all tabernacle items.

verses.text: Then the leaders of Israel, the heads of their fathers' houses, the tribal chiefs over those who were counted, brought offerings.
verses.comment: Emphasis remains on the tribal leaders as those who present gifts.

verses.text: They brought their offerings before the LORD: six covered carts and twelve oxen—a cart for every two leaders, and an ox for each one. They brought them before the tabernacle.
verses.comment: The translation maintains the specific number of carts and oxen as per original.

verses.text: Then the LORD spoke to Moses, saying,
verses.comment: Direct speech from the LORD as in the original text.

verses.text: "Accept these from them, so that they may be used for the service of the tent of meeting. Give them to the Levites, to each according to his service."
verses.comment: Command to distribute gifts to Levites. Wording updated for clarity.

verses.text: So Moses took the carts and the oxen and gave them to the Levites.
verses.comment: Simple statement, kept very close to the Hebrew.

verses.text: He gave two carts and four oxen to the sons of Gershon, according to their service.
verses.comment: Division of gifts matches Levitical duties.

verses.text: And four carts and eight oxen he gave to the sons of Merari, according to their service, under the direction of Ithamar the son of Aaron the priest.
verses.comment: Names and roles as in original text.

verses.text: But to the sons of Kohath he gave none, because theirs was the service of the holy things, which they carried on their shoulders.
verses.comment: Preserves detail that Kohathites carried by hand.

verses.text: Now the leaders presented offerings for the dedication of the altar on the day it was anointed. The leaders brought their offering before the altar.
verses.comment: Day of altar dedication made explicit.

verses.text: The LORD said to Moses, "Let them present their offering, one leader each day, for the dedication of the altar."
verses.comment: One leader per day specified.

verses.text: And the one who presented his offering the first day was Nahshon the son of Amminadab, of the tribe of Judah.
verses.comment: Retains order, leader, and tribal names.

verses.text: His offering was one silver plate, weighing one hundred thirty shekels, and one silver basin, seventy shekels, both by the sanctuary shekel; both filled with fine flour mixed with oil as a grain offering;
verses.comment: Measures and contents kept as literal as possible.

verses.text: one golden dish of ten shekels, filled with incense;
verses.comment: Weight and offering type matched to Hebrew.

verses.text: one young bull, one ram, and one male lamb a year old, for a burnt offering;
verses.comment: Sacrificial animals kept specific with ages.

verses.text: one male goat for a sin offering;
verses.comment: Sin offering, as per instructions in Leviticus.

verses.text: and for a sacrifice of peace offerings: two oxen, five rams, five male goats, and five male lambs a year old. This was the offering of Nahshon the son of Amminadab.
verses.comment: Peace offerings detailed, matching the Hebrew.

verses.text: On the second day Nethanel the son of Zuar, the leader of Issachar, presented his offering;
verses.comment: Leader and tribe for each specific day.

verses.text: He offered one silver plate weighing one hundred thirty shekels, one silver basin of seventy shekels by the sanctuary shekel, both filled with fine flour mixed with oil as a grain offering;
verses.comment: Repeats the detailed gift formula.

verses.text: one golden dish of ten shekels, filled with incense;
verses.comment: Kept word for word with previous offering wording.

verses.text: one young bull, one ram, and one male lamb a year old, for a burnt offering;
one male goat for a sin offering;
and for the sacrifice of peace offerings: two oxen, five rams, five male goats, and five male lambs a year old. This was the offering of Nethanel the son of Zuar.
On the third day Eliab the son of Helon, the leader of the children of Zebulun:
his offering was one silver plate weighing one hundred thirty shekels, and one silver basin of seventy shekels by the sanctuary shekel, both filled with fine flour mixed with oil as a grain offering;
one golden dish of ten shekels, filled with incense;
one young bull, one ram, and one male lamb a year old, for a burnt offering;
one male goat for a sin offering;
and for the sacrifice of peace offerings: two oxen, five rams, five male goats, and five male lambs a year old. This was the offering of Eliab the son of Helon.
On the fourth day Elizur the son of Shedeur, leader of the sons of Reuben:
his offering was one silver plate weighing one hundred thirty shekels, and one silver basin of seventy shekels by the sanctuary shekel, both filled with fine flour mixed with oil as a grain offering;
one golden dish of ten shekels, filled with incense;
one young bull, one ram, and one male lamb a year old, for a burnt offering;
one male goat for a sin offering;
and for the sacrifice of peace offerings: two oxen, five rams, five male goats, and five male lambs a year old. This was the offering of Elizur the son of Shedeur.
On the fifth day Shelumiel the son of Zurishaddai, leader of the sons of Simeon:
his offering was one silver plate weighing one hundred thirty shekels, and one silver basin of seventy shekels by the sanctuary shekel, both filled with fine flour mixed with oil as a grain offering;
one golden dish of ten shekels, filled with incense;
one young bull, one ram, and one male lamb a year old, for a burnt offering;
one male goat for a sin offering;
and for the sacrifice of peace offerings: two oxen, five rams, five male goats, and five male lambs a year old. This was the offering of Shelumiel the son of Zurishaddai.
On the sixth day Eliasaph the son of Deuel, leader of the sons of Gad:
his offering was one silver plate weighing one hundred thirty shekels, and one silver basin of seventy shekels by the sanctuary shekel, both filled with fine flour mixed with oil as a grain offering;
one golden dish of ten shekels, filled with incense;
one young bull, one ram, and one male lamb a year old, for a burnt offering;
one male goat for a sin offering;
and for the sacrifice of peace offerings: two oxen, five rams, five male goats, and five male lambs a year old. This was the offering of Eliasaph son of Deuel.
On the seventh day Elishama the son of Ammihud, leader of the sons of Ephraim:
his offering was one silver plate weighing one hundred thirty shekels, and one silver basin of seventy shekels by the sanctuary shekel, both filled with fine flour mixed with oil as a grain offering;
one golden dish of ten shekels, filled with incense;
one young bull, one ram, and one male lamb a year old, for a burnt offering;
one male goat for a sin offering;
and for the sacrifice of peace offerings: two oxen, five rams, five male goats, and five male lambs a year old. This was the offering of Elishama son of Ammihud.
On the eighth day Gamaliel the son of Pedahzur, leader of the sons of Manasseh:
his offering was one silver plate weighing one hundred thirty shekels, and one silver basin of seventy shekels by the sanctuary shekel, both filled with fine flour mixed with oil as a grain offering;
one golden dish of ten shekels, filled with incense;
one young bull, one ram, and one male lamb a year old, for a burnt offering;
one male goat for a sin offering;
and for the sacrifice of peace offerings: two oxen, five rams, five male goats, and five male lambs a year old. This was the offering of Gamaliel son of Pedahzur.
On the ninth day Abidan the son of Gideoni, leader of the sons of Benjamin:
his offering was one silver plate weighing one hundred thirty shekels, and one silver basin of seventy shekels by the sanctuary shekel, both filled with fine flour mixed with oil as a grain offering;
one golden dish of ten shekels, filled with incense;
one young bull, one ram, and one male lamb a year old, for a burnt offering;
one male goat for a sin offering;
and for the sacrifice of peace offerings: two oxen, five rams, five male goats, and five male lambs a year old. This was the offering of Abidan son of Gideoni.
On the tenth day Ahiezer the son of Ammishaddai, leader of the sons of Dan:
his offering was one silver plate weighing one hundred thirty shekels, and one silver basin of seventy shekels by the sanctuary shekel, both filled with fine flour mixed with oil as a grain offering;
one golden dish of ten shekels, filled with incense;
one young bull, one ram, and one male lamb a year old, for a burnt offering;
one male goat for a sin offering;
and for the sacrifice of peace offerings: two oxen, five rams, five male goats, and five male lambs a year old. This was the offering of Ahiezer son of Ammishaddai.
On the eleventh day Pagiel son of Ochran, leader of the sons of Asher:
his offering was one silver plate weighing one hundred thirty shekels, and one silver basin of seventy shekels by the sanctuary shekel, both filled with fine flour mixed with oil as a grain offering;
one golden dish of ten shekels, filled with incense;
one young bull, one ram, and one male lamb a year old, for a burnt offering;
one male goat for a sin offering;
and for the sacrifice of peace offerings: two oxen, five rams, five male goats, and five male lambs a year old. This was the offering of Pagiel son of Ochran.
On the twelfth day Ahira the son of Enan, leader of the sons of Naphtali:
his offering was one silver plate weighing one hundred thirty shekels, and one silver basin of seventy shekels by the sanctuary shekel, both filled with fine flour mixed with oil as a grain offering;
one golden dish of ten shekels, filled with incense;
one young bull, one ram, and one male lamb a year old, for a burnt offering;
one male goat for a sin offering;
and for the sacrifice of peace offerings: two oxen, five rams, five male goats, and five male lambs a year old. This was the offering of Ahira son of Enan.
This was the dedication offering for the altar, on the day it was anointed, from the leaders of Israel: twelve silver plates, twelve silver basins, twelve golden dishes;
verses.comment: Summary of collective gifts.

verses.text: Each silver plate weighed one hundred thirty shekels, and each basin seventy, with twelve plates and twelve basins, totaling two thousand four hundred shekels of silver, by the sanctuary shekel;
verses.comment: Totals clarified.

verses.text: The twelve golden dishes, filled with incense, weighed ten shekels each by the sanctuary shekel; all the gold of the dishes was one hundred twenty shekels.
All the livestock for the burnt offering amounted to twelve bulls, twelve rams, and twelve male lambs a year old, with their grain offering; and twelve male goats for a sin offering.
verses.comment: Translation reflects word for word summary of offerings.

verses.text: All the livestock for the sacrifice of peace offerings: twenty-four bulls, sixty rams, sixty male goats, and sixty male lambs a year old. These were the dedication offerings for the altar after it was anointed.

When Moses went into the tent of meeting to speak with the LORD, he heard the voice speaking to him from above the mercy seat that was on the ark of the testimony, from between the two cherubim; and he spoke to him.
verses.comment: The image of God’s communication between the cherubim is retained; no major changes to Hebrew intent.
